items.name: basics
items.description: Arrow functions are a more convinient and shorter way to write a function.

items.name: function binding
items.description: Arrow functions have lexical `this`, no dynamic `this`.

items.name: `let` declaration
items.description: `let` restricts the scope of the variable to the current block.

items.name: `const` declaration
items.description: `const` is like `let` plus read-only.

items.name: basics
items.description: ES6 has new shorthands for objects.

items.name: computed properties
items.description: Object literal properties may be computed values.

items.name: getter
items.description: A getter binds an object property to a function that will be called when that property is looked up.

links.comment: Description of all the details of a getter.
"An accessor property associates a key value with one or two accessor functions ..."
Announcement of this kata on twitter.

items.name: setter
items.description: A setter binds an object property to a function to be called when there is an attempt to set that property.

links.comment: Description of all the details of a setter.
"An accessor property associates a key value with one or two accessor functions ..."
The syntax definition of how to write an (accessor) method.
Announcement of this kata on twitter.

items.description: `[].find` makes finding items in arrays easier.

items.description: `[].findIndex` makes finding items in arrays easier.

items.name: `[].entries()`
items.description: `[].entries()` returns an iterator object with all entries.

items.name: `[].keys()`
items.description: `[].keys()` returns an iterator for all keys in the array.

items.description: `[].values()` returns an iterator for all values in the array

items.name: creation

items.description: Generators return iterable objects

items.description: The yield keyword is used to pause and resume a generator function

items.name: send value to a generator
items.description: By calling next() with a parameter, you can pass a value to a generator.

items.name: send function to a generator
items.description: By calling next() with a function, you can pass it to the generator.

items.description: Return statement in a generator function is special.

Describes how a return statement behaves inside a generator.

items.name: `Object.is()`
items.description: `Object.is()` compares if two values are the same.

items.name: basics
